title: U.S. will fund deportations from Panama, expanding migrant crackdown
content: The Biden administration will begin paying for Panama to detain and deport more of the migrants streaming through Central America en route to the United States.
summary: The Biden administration will begin paying for Panama to detain and deport more of the migrants streaming through Central America en route to the United States.

title: Hurricane Beryl is churning west after hitting Caribbean islands. Where it’s headed next.
content: Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell of Grenada said at least three people were killed and the possibility that the toll could rise was a “grim reality.”
summary: Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell of Grenada said at least three people were killed and the possibility that the toll could rise was a “grim reality.”

title: Why Beryl is an early sign of a particularly dangerous hurricane season
content: Not all storms will become behemoths like Beryl. But the hurricane has underscored the ways the stage is set for other storms to undergo similarly explosive development
summary: Not all storms will become behemoths like Beryl. But the hurricane has underscored the ways the stage is set for other storms to undergo similarly explosive development

title: Hurricane Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
content: Beryl is expected to pass near Jamaica on Wednesday.
summary: Beryl is expected to pass near Jamaica on Wednesday.

title: Russia’s devastating glide bombs keep falling on its own territory
content: Internal Russian documents show how often its glide bombs hit its own territory, likely due to faulty guidance systems, say experts.
summary: Internal Russian documents show how often its glide bombs hit its own territory, likely due to faulty guidance systems, say experts.

title: Iran is picking a new president. Here’s what to know.
content: A reformist and a conservative will face off in the second round of voting.
summary: A reformist and a conservative will face off in the second round of voting.

title: What DIY dentistry has to do with the British election
content: Dentistry has emerged as a top election issue, with politicians’ inboxes filled with complaints from constituents about a lack of access to affordable care.
summary: Dentistry has emerged as a top election issue, with politicians’ inboxes filled with complaints from constituents about a lack of access to affordable care.

title: More than 100 killed in Indian religious event stampede, officials say
content: The stampede at a religious event in northern India was among the country’s deadliest in recent years.
summary: The stampede at a religious event in northern India was among the country’s deadliest in recent years.

title: Israel orders Palestinians to evacuate parts of Khan Younis once again
content: The evacuation orders will affect 250,000 people, many of whom have nowhere to go amid difficult conditions, warned the United Nations.
summary: The evacuation orders will affect 250,000 people, many of whom have nowhere to go amid difficult conditions, warned the United Nations.

title: Hungarian leader Viktor Orban visits Ukraine and suggests a cease-fire
content: Orban has repeatedly blocked or weakened European efforts to provide Ukraine with security assistance throughout the war, frustrating its leader.
summary: Orban has repeatedly blocked or weakened European efforts to provide Ukraine with security assistance throughout the war, frustrating its leader.

title: New Zealand, once a utopia for Trump-weary exiles, turns to the right
content: The populist National-led government is undoing many of Jacinda Ardern’s progressive initiatives, including gun control and environmental protections.
summary: The populist National-led government is undoing many of Jacinda Ardern’s progressive initiatives, including gun control and environmental protections.

title: Hurricane Beryl at Category 5 strength after making landfall in Caribbean
content: Beryl shattered records as it strengthened in unusually warm waters, churning through Grenada’s Carriacou. It was predicted to skirt Jamaica on Wednesday.
summary: Beryl shattered records as it strengthened in unusually warm waters, churning through Grenada’s Carriacou. It was predicted to skirt Jamaica on Wednesday.

title: Severe turbulence injures over 30, diverts Air Europa flight to Brazil
content: Passengers described the incident to local media as “terrifying” and like a “horror movie.” Videos on social media showed damaged seats and overhead compartments.
summary: Passengers described the incident to local media as “terrifying” and like a “horror movie.” Videos on social media showed damaged seats and overhead compartments.

title: This Israeli hostage mother supported Netanyahu. Now she wants him gone.
content: Einav Zangauker, whose son Matan was kidnapped on Oct. 7, is at the forefront of anti-government protests calling on Israel’s prime minister to step down.
summary: Einav Zangauker, whose son Matan was kidnapped on Oct. 7, is at the forefront of anti-government protests calling on Israel’s prime minister to step down.

title: What happens next in French elections as far right leads in first vote
content: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections after a second round of voting.
summary: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections after a second round of voting.

title: As Macron fades and far right surges, French left senses an opening
content: Ahead of this weekend’s runoff election, France’s leftist alliance wants to recast itself as the primary competition to the rising far right.
summary: Ahead of this weekend’s runoff election, France’s leftist alliance wants to recast itself as the primary competition to the rising far right.

title: Head of Gaza’s al-Shifa Hospital released after months of detention
content: Pulled from a U.N. convoy, Mohamed Abu Salmiya’s detention bookended one of the most indelible chapters of Israel’s nine-month military operation in Gaza.
summary: Pulled from a U.N. convoy, Mohamed Abu Salmiya’s detention bookended one of the most indelible chapters of Israel’s nine-month military operation in Gaza.

title: E.U. says Meta’s ‘pay or consent’ ads violate competition law
content: Regulators say the tech giant breached the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they don’t want personal data used to generate targeted ads.
summary: Regulators say the tech giant breached the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they don’t want personal data used to generate targeted ads.

title: With ‘Make Europe Great Again,’ Hungary taunts allies, touts hard right
content: Hungary takes up the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on Monday, putting the spotlight on Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
summary: Hungary takes up the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on Monday, putting the spotlight on Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

title: A 28-year-old is the face of France’s far right: Who is Jordan Bardella?
content: Bardella joined the National Rally at 16 and was elected its president in 2022. He could become prime minister if his party wins an upcoming vote.
summary: Bardella joined the National Rally at 16 and was elected its president in 2022. He could become prime minister if his party wins an upcoming vote.

title: What Taiwan is learning from the war in Ukraine
content: For the Taiwanese public, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has revealed the dangers at their own doorstep, said Taiwan’s de facto ambassador in Washington.
summary: For the Taiwanese public, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has revealed the dangers at their own doorstep, said Taiwan’s de facto ambassador in Washington.
